docs.snippet: A reporter catalogues some interesting, scary and uplifting experiences while covering the World Cup in South Africa.

docs.snippet: The Spanish team reached the semifinals for the first time by beating Paraguay, 1-0, on a late goal by David Villa, the tournament’s leading scorer.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Spanish team reached the semifinals for the first time by beating Paraguay, 1-0, on a late goal by David Villa, the tournament’s leading scorer.

headline.seo: Villa, Old Mainstay, Brings Spain New World Cup Glory
headline.main: With Another Late Goal, Spain Finds New Heights
headline.print_headline: With Another Late Goal, Spain Finds New Heights

docs.snippet: Scorers need to be assertive, but if they become too selfish team chemistry suffers.
docs.lead_paragraph: In sports it can be good to be selfish. Around the Ajax youth academy a story is often told of the young Johan Cruyff. For those who do not know, Cruyff is considered the best player the Netherlands has ever had. Internationally he ranks among the greats, just slightly behind Maradona and Pele.
docs.abstract: Scorers need to be assertive, but if they become too selfish team chemistry suffers.

headline.main: Finding the Right Amount of Selfishness

docs.snippet: Before Friday, the power in this tournament belonged to South American favorites. But they found out how quickly it can all go wrong.
docs.lead_paragraph: Before Friday, the power in this tournament belonged to South American favorites. But they found out how quickly it can all go wrong.

docs.snippet: The Uruguay-Netherlands semifinal has an inescapable subtext.
docs.lead_paragraph: You can't help but hear the incongruities in some of the things being said ahead of Tuesday's Netherlands-Uruguay semifinal in Cape Town.
docs.abstract: The Uruguay-Netherlands semifinal has an inescapable subtext.

headline.main: Uruguay and the 'Real Hand of God'

docs.snippet: The referees for the semifinals were announced today, and the full list of candidates to officiate the final four games was posted.

docs.abstract: The referees for the semifinals were announced today, and the full list of candidates to officiate the final four games was posted.

headline.main: Semifinal Referees Announced; Conspiracy Theories Abound

docs.snippet: Previewing the Uruguay-Netherlands World Cup semifinal.
docs.lead_paragraph: World Cup Semifinal: Uruguay vs. Netherlands2:30 p.m. EasternTV: ESPN, UnivisionTwo teams with deep World Cup traditions meet in a semifinal in Cape Town. Uruguay has won the tournament twice - in 1930 and 1950 - but has not reached this stage in 40 years. The Netherlands, famed for decades for elegant play, reached consecutive finals in 1974 and 1978 but has never won the Cup. Diego Forlán and Luis Suárez have led Uruguay with three goals each, but Suárez is unavailable for this match; his intentional goal-line handball - cynical or brilliant, depending on your view - saved his team in the dying seconds of regulation time against Ghana but earned him a red card and a one-game suspension. The gritty play of Mark van Bommel in the Netherlands' midfield gives Robin van Persie, Arjen Robben and Wesley Sneijder the freedom to attack. Sneijder, an eagle-eyed playmaker, has scored four goals.
docs.abstract: Previewing the Uruguay-Netherlands World Cup semifinal.
